info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shippensburg, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Chambersburg, Waynesboro, Shippensburg, Guilford, Carroll Valley, Fayetteville, Wayne Heights, Mont Alto, Scotland, Rouzerville, Cashtown, Orrtanna, Fairfield, McKnightstown, Quincy, Liberty Mountain Resort and Penn State Mont Alto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
